page.title: 20Conclusion and views
page.content: Schools were responsible for the following pages:3,4,5-Sweyne;6,7,8- Down Hall;9,10,11-Wyburns;12,13,14,15 Grove;16,17,18,19-Edward Francis. PUPILS VIEWS:"it was interesting and a change from normal work...it will be very useful for the people in the future to see the shops we have...more time would have been good...some of the detail work was boring...smaller areas would have made more visits possible...I enjoyed using Yellow pages and the maps. STAFF VIEWS:Time was too limited.The central organisation was often more a hindrance than a help.The BBC seemed to have made little attempt to work out the practical problems in advance. Nonetheless it was felt to be useful exercise and simulation,assisting schools to cooperate an work as one.
